Amumu, Sej),  because for them to be at a power level that succeeds in competitive, their normal play power will be over 9000. > [{quoted}](name=PiVoRx,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JjArarqg,comment-id=00180000,timestamp=2016-12-30T04:24:15.472+0000)
>
> When Akali was strong? I only remember her being viable with some tank Korean build but thats it.

It was a good 2-3 seasons ago I believe. If you didn't kill her before level 6, you would pretty much lose the lane. Many times, even if you did kill her, as soon as she got Hextech revolver and her ult, you would lose trades anyway, because she had too much sustain. If you were playing anyone remotely squishy, you would get bursted as soon as she jumped on you, and then you were zoned while she shrugged off your harass with spell vamp. 

The revolver changes alone were a significant nerf to her early power, then once she got reworked I just haven't seen her at all.
2-3 seassons ago you could reveal her with red trinket and just laugh how she sits doing nothing thinking shes invisible xd

It's been a long time, but I do remember her being overbearing at one point and warranting nerfs. A lot of champions couldn't push her out of lane or trade with her, mostly due to the access of early spell vamp.

As someone who one-tricked her last season, I can say that if you altered her build accordingly, she had essentially zero bad matchups.  All you needed was revolver to instapop squishies at 6.  At 1050 gold for it, that meant you could delay it in rough matchups like Annie, Leblanc, and Azir to get an early Spectre's Cowl.  Then you could sustain through their entire mana pool and free farm.

My winrate was almost right at 70% over the course of 100 or so games in ranked last season with her.  She was absolutely overbearing in the right hands.

Also, the bug with her old shroud was entirely unfair.  Used correctly, you could walk right up to their back line, invisible, while they were unable to see the shroud was even down.  Or she could seemingly disappear if she went around a corner and dropped vision long enough to exploit the shroud bug.

New Akali just isn't as fun to play.  She needs some tweaks to her mechanics, but straight damage buffs aren't necessary (maybe on her ult...)
